message.entry: Either the numerator or the denominator of the transfer function as specified by the block parameters is empty.
Denominator of the transfer function cannot be a matrix. Change it to a row vector.
The given transfer function is an improper transfer function. The order of the transfer function numerator must be less than or equal to the order of the denominator.

The given transfer function is an improper transfer function because all coefficients of the numerator and the denominator are considered tunable at run time. The order of the transfer function numerator must be less than or equal to the order of the denominator.
A time domain realization of the given transfer function for block ''{0}'' failed. Check values of ''{1}'' and ''{2}'' parameters.

A change in parameters ''{0}'' and ''{1}'' for the transfer function block ''{2}'' causes a structural change in the time domain realization of the transfer function. This is not allowed when the simulation is running.
A change in the order of the denominator results in a change in the number of states in the time domain realization of the transfer function.

A change in numerator introduces a direct dependency of the output on the block input in the time domain realization of the transfer function. However, the simulation was started with no such dependency.
The denominator of the transfer function block ''{0}'' has leading zeros which can lead to a mismatch in results between different simulation modes and/or code generation targets.
The denominator of the transfer function block ''{0}'' has leading zeros which will cause the state-space realization to have non-finite values and cause the simulation to fail.
